measure.name: air_handling_unit_fan_motor_degradation
measure.display_name: Air Handling Unit Fan Motor Degradation
measure.description: Fan motor degradation occurs due to bearing and stator winding faults, leading to a decrease in motor efficiency and an increase in overall fan power consumption. This measure simulates the air handling unit fan motor degradation by modifying either the Fan:ConstantVolume, Fan:VariableVolume, or the Fan:OnOff objects in EnergyPlus assigned to the ventilation system. The fault intensity (F) for this fault is defined as the ratio of fan motor efficiency degradation.
measure.modeler_description: Two user inputs are required and, based on these user inputs, the fan efficiency is recalculated to reflect the faulted operation as shown below, where η_(fan,tot,F) is the degraded total efficiency under faulted condition, η_(fan,tot) is the total efficiency under normal condition, and F is the fault intensity. η_(fan,tot,F) = η_(fan,tot)∙(1-F)

argument.name: fan_choice
argument.display_name: Enter the name of the faulted Fan:ConstantVolume, Fan:OnOff object or Fan:VariableVolume. If you want to impose the fault on all fan objects in the building, enter * ALL Fan objects *

argument.name: eff_degrad_fac
argument.display_name: Degradation factor of the total efficiency of the fan during the simulation period. If the fan is not faulted, set it to zero.

argument.name: sch_choice
argument.display_name: Enter the name of the schedule of the fault level. If you do not have a schedule, leave this blank.
